title: Be a Volunteer
intro1: Many of the dogs that come to us are shy, suspicious, scared or traumatized. We can only imagine what they have been through: abandoned, beaten, chased away, starved. Earning their trust is a long process ‚Äî they need positive experiences to understand that not all humans are bad, and that a hand reaching towards them may pet them, not hurt them.
intro2: Unfortunately, we do not have enough time to spend with each dog as much as they need, and their recovery becomes more difficult and longer. This means a longer waiting period in the shelter before they can be adopted.
highlight: üê∂ If you love dogs, understand what a scared soul needs, and have free time, we would be happy to welcome you as a volunteer at CARPE!
intro3: Your help can make the difference between a scared dog and an adoptable one. And if you don't feel comfortable working directly with animals, we have many other activities where your help is extremely important:

tasks.t1: Feeding and providing water for dogs and cats
tasks.t2: Repairs in the shelter (shade nets, fences, etc.)
tasks.t4: Arranging the cat garden (fence, net roof)
tasks.t5: Photos and videos of the dogs

tipsTitle: What you need to know when visiting an animal shelter

tips.tip1: Dogs will be agitated at the beginning ‚Äî some from excitement, others from fear.
tips.tip2: They are used to their kennels, their safe space.
tips.tip3: Most are friendly, but some may react unexpectedly due to past trauma. Do not enter any kennel without guidance from an experienced volunteer.
tips.tip4: Make sure no dog escapes from the kennel ‚Äî it‚Äôs crucial for their safety.
tips.tip5: Be aware of scratches from fences and insects.

recommendations.r1: Wear long clothes (long pants and long-sleeve shirt)
recommendations.r3: Be gentle, patient and positive ‚Äî your energy matters a lot to the dogs
